For Salna Masala Paste.step_text: Heat oil in a pan, add coconut, peanuts along with dry ingredients like fennel seeds, cumin seeds, cardamom, cinnamon and pepper corn.
Roast all the spices on low flame for 2-3 minutes. Once done, blend them in a blender by adding water as required to make a consistent paste. (when cool down).
Now heat oil in another pan again, add sliced onions, curry leaves along with ginger garlic paste and salt to taste.
Saute for few minutes until onions get transculent and soft.
Now, add in chopped tomatoes and cover the lid until tomatoes get soft and juiced down.
Add curry powder (optional) along with red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder and salt to taste.
Then add chicken pieces and mix everything so well.
Add water and cover the lid for 15-20 minutes and keep stirring meanwhile to avoid burning.
Add coriander leaves and mint leaves to garnish.
Serve it hot with parotta, rice or idli.
